info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 3:43PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL LINCOLN COUNTY THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 342 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ruidoso Downs, or near Ruidoso. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ruidoso, Ruidoso Downs, Glencoe, San Patricio and Hollywood. This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 103 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
